alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 8:52PM AKST until January 15 at 10:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUES IN THE THE NEW WORK WEEK... .The three day system appears to be on its last legs with the northerly frontal boundary beginning to pick up speeds as it moves southward. Yakutat has had nearly all of its moisture and lift move southward with Haines and Skagway to follow next. The bulk of the moisture appears to be around the central panhandle and Juneau, with rates around half an inch per hour and PW around 150% of normal. Similar rates can be found around Haines and Skagway, however, this is due to enhanced lift from a boundary between two air masses. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Haines Borough and Klukwan. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will continue to diminish this evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
